description: Number of days from sowing/planting to 50% of plants in the plot showing anthesis (pollen shed).
Number of days from sowing/planting to 50% of plants in the plot showing silking (silks visible).
Difference in days between anthesis and silking (days_to_anthesis - days_to_silking); indicator of stress (longer ASI often reduces yield).
Vertical distance from soil surface to the highest point of the main stem (usually measured in cm).
Vertical distance from soil surface to the node bearing the primary ear (cm).
Visual score or percentage indicating how well the husk covers the ear (degree of exposed kernels; scored on a standard scale).
Visual overall score of plant vigor/appearance (usually a 1–5 or 1–9 scale where lower = desirable).
Fresh weight of the whole plot at harvest (kg) — often used before drying to compute fresh biomass. (term may be dataset-specific).
Number of ears physically harvested from the sampled plants or plot.
Average number of ears (or cobs) produced per plant in the sampled area.
Visual score of ear quality (shape, filling, grain set) on a standard scale (lower = better).
Percent moisture content of grain at harvest (measured with moisture meter or drying).
Dry grain weight per unit area (commonly kg/ha or t/ha) after standard drying to target moisture.
Score (or percent) indicating the degree to which foliage remains green during grain filling/late-season (delayed senescence).
Height of the plant canopy (cm) — often measured as mean height of foliage layer. (similar to plant_height but refers to canopy).
Number of branches arising from the main stem per plant (relevant for branching crops).
Number of peduncles (flower stalks/panicle stalks) produced per plant.
Number of pods per plant (for legumes) counted on sampled plants.
Total number of seeds collected from the sampled plot (useful for seed yield estimates).
Mass (g) of 100 seeds (100-seed weight) — measured after drying; indicator of seed size.
Mass of plant material after drying to constant weight (kg or % of fresh weight); used to compute biomass.
Ratio of economic yield (grain) to total above-ground biomass (grain / total dry biomass), usually expressed as fraction or percent.
Dry weight of vegetative biomass suitable for fodder per unit area (kg/ha or t/ha).
Number of grains (kernels) per panicle/panicle-equivalent (or ear) counted on sampled panicles.
Maximum width of the panicle (cm), measured on harvested panicles.
Length of the panicle (cm) from base to tip (harvested).
Number of panicles per plot or per plant (depending on protocol).
Mass (g) of 1000 seeds (sometimes used instead of 100-seed weight for small-seeded crops).
Number of tillers (secondary stems) per main plant (important in cereals like rice, wheat).
Number of leaves per main stem (counted to a defined growth stage).
Number of panicles harvested from the sampled plants or plot.
Length of an individual leaf (cm) — protocol specifies which leaf to measure (e.g., topmost fully expanded).
Maximum width of an individual leaf (cm) — protocol specifies which leaf to measure.
Degree to which grain is covered by bracts/husk/lemma (visual score or percent); relates to exposure and quality.
